references.reason: This paper introduces the foundation of denoising diffusion probabilistic models, a core technology used in the described SG2I framework.

references.paper_title: Diffusion models beat gans on image synthesis
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the superior performance of diffusion models compared to GANs in image synthesis, motivating the use of diffusion models in the proposed approach.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, is a crucial component for aligning text and image data, enabling effective scene graph construction and multi-modal training in the proposed SG2I framework.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces latent diffusion models (LDMs), which are highly efficient for generating high-resolution images and are employed in the proposed DisCo framework.
This seminal paper explores scene graph-to-image generation, providing a foundation for the task and introducing key concepts that are built upon in this research.
